job.title: Lead Innovative Software Engineer - Innovation Labs
job.description: Are you passionate about applying emerging technologies to solve customer problems Lowes Innovation Labs is whats next for home improvement retail With a focus on emerging technologies  ranging from 3D visualization to mixed reality to robotics to things we cant talk about right now  our team accelerates the experiences that customers expect today and develops the capabilities that power tomorrowltbrgtltbrgtWe are seeking experienced Full Stack Software Engineers to focus on solving unique and complex technical problems that face our internal and external customers Software Engineers on our team prototype new ideas build innovative experiences at scale and enhance existing products Our team is building the nextgeneration of products that empower home improvement customers and transform home improvement retail Join usltbrgtltbrgtThis position is fulltime and based in our Kirkland WA officeltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtltugtWhat You Will Be Working OnltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligtDesign and implement features for our content management and build systemsltligtltligtDevelop microservices in NodeJSPythonC or other languagesltligtltligtDesign Restful APIs with different product requirements security scalability platform etcltligtltligtDevelop full stack webmobile applications with a variety of languages including but not limited to C JavaScript HTML etcltligtltligtWork on data pipelines and tooling to enable fast iterationsltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtJob SummaryltbrgtltbrgtltugtltstronggtThe primary purpose of this role is to provide consultation and technical direction on translating business requirements and functional specifications into logical program designs This includes facilitating the implementation and maintenance of complex business and enterprise software solutions to ensure successful deployment of released applications This role serves as a technical expert for project teams throughout the implementation and maintenance of business and enterprise software solutions In addition this role personally develops and delivers code modules stable application systems and integrated enterprise software solutions within various computing environmentsltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtltugtKey Responsibilitiesltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligt Resolves complex problems spanning multiple applications to drive improvements across portfolios leads projects with significant business implications participates in planning and priority estimates and advises Software Engineers executes with limited guidanceltligtltligt Leads development of integrated business andor enterprise application solutions to ensure specifications are flexible scalable and maintainable and meet architectural standardsltligtltligt Educates others on current architectural standards and guidelines to drive efficiency when leading the design efforts of complex business and enterprise software solutionsltligtltligt Supports systems integration testing SIT and user acceptance testing UAT for large complex crossfunctional application initiatives by providing insight to testing teams in order to ensure the appropriate depth of test coverageltligtltligt Mentors and advises others in all software development lifecycle phases by applying and sharing an indepth understanding of company and industry methodologies policies standards and controlsltligtltligt Communicates changes in software architecture and coaches others to apply this understanding to software solutions resolves escalated issuesltligtltligt Leads efforts to improve engineering test and operational excellence best practicesltligtltligt Solves complex crossfunctional architecturedesign and business problems solutions are extensible works to simplify optimize remove bottlenecks etcltligtltligt Mentors and advises others sharing an indepth understanding of company and industry methodologies policies standards and controlsltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtMinimum Qualificationsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligt Bachelors degree in Computer Science CIS or related fieldltligtltligt 7 years of experience in software development or a related fieldltligtltligt 6 years of experience in database technologiesltligtltligt 6 years of experience working on projects involving the implementation of solutions applying development life cycles SDLCltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtPreferred Qualificationsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligt Masters degree in Computer Science CIS or related fieldltligtltligt 6 years of IT experience developing and implementing business systems within an organizationltligtltligt 6 years of experience working with defect or incident tracking softwareltligtltligt 6 years of experience writing technical documentation in a software development environmentltligtltligt 4 years of experience working with an IT Infrastructure Library ITIL frameworkltligtltligt 4 years of experience leading teams with or without direct reportsltligtltligt 6 years of experience working with source code control systemsltligtltligt Experience working with Continuous Integration Continuous Deployment toolsltligtltligt 6 years of experience in systems analysis including defining technical requirements and performing high level design for complex solutionsltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtAbout LowesltbrgtltbrgtltugtltstronggtLowes Companies Inc NYSE LOW is a FORTUNE 50 home improvement company serving approximately 18 million customers a week in the United States and Canada With fiscal year 2019 sales of 721 billion Lowes and its related businesses operate or service more than 2200 home improvement and hardware stores and employ approximately 300000 associates Based in Mooresville NC Lowes supports its hometown Charlotte region and all communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts For more information visit LowescomltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtltugtAbout Lowes In The CommunityltbrgtltbrgtltugtltstronggtAs a FORTUNE 50 home improvement company Lowes is committed to creating safe affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts through nonprofit partnerships Across every community we serve Lowes associates donate their time and expertise through the Lowes Heroes volunteer program For the latest news visit NewsroomLowescom or follow LowesMedia on Twitter
